line.originaltext: 3 gallons peanut oil for frying, or as needed
1 (12 pound) whole turkey, neck and giblets removed
1/4 cup Creole seasoning
1 white onion
In a large stockpot or turkey fryer, heat oil to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
In a large stockpot or turkey fryer, heat oil to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
line.annotation: cook(ing15, t4, ing19, "hot oil", "heat oil to 400 degrees F")

line.originaltext: Be sure to leave room for the turkey, or the oil will spill over.
line.annotation: chefcheck(ing19,"leave room for turkey in fryer")

line.originaltext: Layer a large platter with food-safe paper bags.
Layer a large platter with food-safe paper bags.
Rinse turkey, and thoroughly pat dry with paper towels.
Rinse turkey, and thoroughly pat dry with paper towels.

line.annotation: do(ing20, t6, ing21, "clean turkey", "pat thoroughly dry")

line.originaltext: Rub Creole seasoning over turkey inside and out.
line.annotation: combine({ing17, ing21}, ing22, "seasoned turkey", "rub seasoning over turkey inside and out")

line.originaltext: Make sure the hole at the neck is open at least 2 inches so the oil can flow freely through the bird.
line.annotation: chefcheck(ing22,"hole at neck is open at least 2 inches")

line.originaltext: Place the whole onion and turkey in drain basket.
Place the whole onion and turkey in drain basket.
Place the whole onion and turkey in drain basket.
The turkey should be placed in basket neck end first.
line.annotation: chefcheck(ing23,"turkey in basket neck end first")

line.originaltext: Slowly lower basket into hot oil to completely cover turkey.

Maintain the temperature of the oil at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and cook turkey for 3 1/2 minutes per pound, about 45 minutes.
